content: Peach trees can be grown in containers, but they require proper care and maintenance. The container should be at least 15 gallons in size and provide adequate drainage. The tree should be planted in a well-draining potting mix and receive full sun for at least six hours a day. Additionally, peach trees in containers will require frequent watering and fertilizing to ensure healthy growth. However, planting a peach tree in the ground may offer greater longevity and yield.
